channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Virginia on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Are Language Models Actually Useful for Time Series Forecasting?
item.description: Popular large language model (LLM)-based time series forecasting methods perform no better than simpler alternatives, often worse, and require vastly more compute.

item.title: Constrained Synthesis with Projected Diffusion Models
item.description: Projected Diffusion Models (PDM) revolutionizes generative modeling by directly incorporating constraints into the sampling process, ensuring high-fidelity outputs that strictly adhere to predefined c…

item.title: Corruption-Robust Linear Bandits: Minimax Optimality and Gap-Dependent Misspecification
item.description: This paper presents novel algorithms for linear bandits that are robust to corrupted rewards, achieving minimax optimality and optimal scaling for gap-dependent misspecification, extending to reinforc…

item.title: Easy Regional Contrastive Learning of Expressive Fashion Representations
item.description: E2, a novel regional contrastive learning method, enhances vision-language models for expressive fashion representations by explicitly attending to fashion details with minimal additional parameters, …

item.title: Efficient Prompt Optimization Through the Lens of Best Arm Identification
item.description: TRIPLE: Efficient prompt optimization using fixed-budget best-arm identification.

item.title: Learning Group Actions on Latent Representations
item.description: This paper proposes a novel method to model group actions within autoencoders by learning these actions in the latent space, enhancing model versatility and improving performance in various real-world…

item.title: Mixture of Demonstrations for In-Context Learning
item.description: MoD, a novel Mixture of Demonstrations framework, enhances in-context learning by partitioning demonstration pools and employing expert-wise training, achieving state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: Transformers as Game Players: Provable In-context Game-playing Capabilities of Pre-trained Models
item.description: Pre-trained transformers can provably learn to play games near-optimally using in-context learning, offering theoretical guarantees for both decentralized and centralized settings.

item.title: Unveiling User Satisfaction and Creator Productivity Trade-Offs in Recommendation Platforms
item.description: Recommendation algorithms on UGC platforms face a critical trade-off: prioritizing user satisfaction reduces creator engagement, jeopardizing long-term content diversity. This research introduces a ga…
